content.description:
This climbs the west side of Rift Rock by the tree. Try not to dab on said tree.

Sit start with right-facing hand holds (see the photo) and good feet. Pull up, and find the decent seam for hands. Move out a little left to the obvious horns. Try and find higher hands to gain a nice, left heel hook. Search again for a decent left or right hand, and top out.

Downclimb the east side of the boulder. Reward yourself with some Raine...I mean multi-colored cherries.

Sit start with a left hand incut edge and a right hand sidepull. From there, achieve a right heel hook, gain a good right hand edge, continue up through a pair of horizontal rails to top it out through the notch at the lip.
content.protection: A pad will work well, the landing is flat and clear.
content.location: It climbs the center, north face of Rift Rock.

content.description: Sit start with hands matched on the vertical feature. From there, achieve a high right foot edge, bump to a left crimp, follow to a right hand edge, then the prominent seam, gain good footing, follow the near-vertical crack to the lip and mantel on top.
content.protection: A pad or two will work great, the landing is very good, but there is a rock just right of the fall zone.
content.location: It climbs the western section of Rift's north face.

content.description: Sit start with your choice of edge. From there, work up through bumps and edges to a great diagonal rail, reach the lip, mantel atop the boulder.
content.protection: A pad will do, the landing is spectacular.
content.location: It climbs the eastern section of Rift Rock's north face.

content.description: Stand start matched on a diagonal rail. From there, climb straight up through a series of edges and bumps to reach an easy mantel.
content.protection: A pair of pads and a spot would be ideal. There is a large boulder directly to the left of the problem and a juniper tree behind it.
content.location: It climbs the south face of Rift. Directly in front of the juniper tree.
